de.iss.mv2.security

Class CertificateSigner

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.iss.mv2.security.CertificateSigner

  • public class CertificateSigner
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to sign a given certificate signing request with an existing certificate.
    Author:
    Marcel Singer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private CertificateManager certManager
      Contains the manager to handle the signed certificates.
      private java.util.Date endDate
      Contains the end date of validity.
      private java.security.SecureRandom random
      Contains a randomizer used for creating the serial number for a signed certificate.
      private java.security.cert.X509Certificate signerCert
      Contains the certificate of the signing instance.
      private java.util.Date startDate
      Stores the start date of validity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CertificateSigner

        public CertificateSigner(java.security.cert.X509Certificate issuerCert,
                         CertificateManager manager,
                         java.security.SecureRandom random)
        Creates a new instance of CertificateSigner.
        Parameters:
        issuerCert - The certificate of the signing instance.
        manager - An instance of CertificateManager to handle the signed certificates.
        random - An instance of SecureRandom to generate the serial numbers.

      • getSignerKeyIdentifier

        private org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.AuthorityKeyIdentifier getSignerKeyIdentifier()
                                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the key identifier of the signing instance.
        Returns:
        The key identifier of the signing instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • getKeyIdentifier

        private org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.SubjectKeyIdentifier getKeyIdentifier(org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.SubjectPublicKeyInfo pk)
                                                                  throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Returns the key identifier of the requesting instance.
        Parameters:
        pk - The SubjectPublicKeyInfo of the requesting instance.
        Returns:
        The key identifier of the requesting instance.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If there is no algorithm for the given SubjectPublicKeyInfo.

      • getCertificateManager

        public CertificateManager getCertificateManager()
        Returns the certificate manager used by this instance.
        Returns:
        The certificate manager used by this instance.

      • sign

        public java.security.cert.X509Certificate sign(java.security.PrivateKey caKey,
                                               org.bouncycastle.pkcs.PKCS10CertificationRequest signingRequest,
                                               boolean allowResign)
                                        throws org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException,
                                               java.io.IOException,
                                               java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                                               java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                               java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Signs the given certificate signing request.
        Parameters:
        caKey - The private key of the signing instance. This key must belong to the certificate given at CertificateSigner(X509Certificate, CertificateManager, SecureRandom) .
        signingRequest - The request to be signed.
        allowResign - true if the requesting instance should be allowed to sign other request.
        Returns:
        The signed certificate.
        Throws:
        org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - If there was an exception creating the requesting instance's certificate.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If an required algorithm implementation was not found.
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - If a required key was invalid.
